mentions.context: TopRank handles a wider range of click models than PB-MHB, but it also assumes the knowledge of the order on positions.
TopRank hyper-parameter δ is set to 1/T as recommended by Theorem 1 in [18].
Anyhow, we also compare PB-MHB to TopRank [18] in Section 5 in order to ensure that our model benefits from the knowledge of the click model.
We compare the performance of PB-MHB with the performance of PMED [14], TopRank [18], and the standard baseline ε n -greedy [3].
Namely, κ κ κ values are decreasing when running experiments with PMED and TopRank.

Regarding computation time, apart from PMED all the algorithms require less than 20 ms per recommendation which remains affordable: n -Greedy is the fastest with less than 0.5ms per recommendation 8 ; then TopRank and PB-MHB require 10 to 40 times more computation time than n -Greedy; finally, PMED requires more than 150ms per recommendation which makes it impractical regardless of its low regret.
